certainty number is returned they determine if there was a match or not if there was a match then the crawlers will
use that classifier to extract the schema as well as apply that classification to your table Glu

in just a few minutes so this is how
glue would classify your data on s3 it would eliminate enumerate the objects on
s3 and then identify the schema at each file or object it would apply a set of
classifiers to that object and then it would merge that schema for objects that
are similar or have the same classification and then finally you would get the schema at each partition
level and then at each table level that would then get added to the glue data catalog so the way glue determines if
there was a match or not against a particular classifier is based on the
similarity index that it generates so it assigns a point for every match of name
as well as a point for every match of data type so here in this example you
can see that it assigns a point for the root because it matches a name it also
assigns a point for name as well as ID and also address but for data types the
address is not matching in data types so it will only assign a point for the data types of the other three nodes so you
would get in a similarity index of about 87% and for any similarity index about
70% glue would assume that there is a match and then continue to combine schema and build your table definition
